title: Songs of Salvation
shortSummary: Isaiah chapter 12 is a hymn of praise and thanksgiving celebrating God's salvation and comfort. It expresses trust in the Lord’s strength and joyfully calls the people to proclaim His mighty deeds and exalt His name among the nations.
timeline: c. 8th century BC - Isaiah's prophetic ministry during the reign of King Hezekiah

keyCharacters.name: The Prophet Isaiah
keyCharacters.description: The author and speaker who declares God's message of salvation and comfort to His people.

keyCharacters.name: The Inhabitants of Zion
keyCharacters.description: The people of Jerusalem who are called to rejoice and praise the Lord for His deliverance.

definitions.definition: A transliteration of the Hebrew name of God, often rendered LORD in English Bibles, emphasizing God's eternal, self-existent nature.
A metaphor for the abundant and life-giving provision of God's deliverance and grace.
A title for God emphasizing His holiness and unique relationship with the nation of Israel.
The hill of Jerusalem, symbolizing the city of God and His people.

outline.heading: Declaration of Praise and Comfort
outline.description: The prophet expresses personal gratitude for God's turned anger and comforting salvation, affirming trust in the LORD as strength and song.

outline.heading: Joyful Drawing from Salvation
outline.description: An invitation to joyfully draw water from the wells of salvation, symbolizing the refreshing and sustaining nature of God’s deliverance.

outline.heading: Call to Public Praise and Proclamation
outline.description: A communal call to praise God openly, declare His deeds, exalt His name, and rejoice because the Holy One of Israel dwells in their midst.

application: Trust in God’s salvation even in times of personal trial, knowing He is your strength and comfort.
Rejoice and express your faith through praise, recognizing the great things God has done in your life.
Boldly proclaim God’s name and works to others as a testimony of His power and faithfulness.
Remember that God’s presence with His people is a cause for confident worship and joyful celebration.

keyVerses.text: Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and not be afraid: for the LORD JEHOVAH is my strength and my song; he also is become my salvation.
keyVerses.significance: This verse encapsulates the chapter’s theme of trusting God as the source of salvation and strength.

keyVerses.text: Therefore with joy shall ye draw water out of the wells of salvation.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the joy and refreshment found in God’s saving grace.

keyVerses.text: Cry out and shout, thou inhabitant of Zion: for great is the Holy One of Israel in the midst of thee.
keyVerses.significance: This verse calls for exuberant praise because of God’s holy presence among His people.
